project.teaser: The main objective of the project is to contribute to the promotion of cultural and creative tourism activities, considering the different capacities, resources, and specificities (material, creative, human...) of the territories, as a mean to help with the sustainable...
project.objective:
The main objective of the project is to contribute to the promotion of cultural and creative tourism activities, considering the different capacities, resources, and specificities (material, creative, human...) of the territories, as a mean to help with the sustainable development of peripheral rural areas, favoring job creation and population settlement. For this, the potential of its cultural heritage will be researched, taking into account both the artisan material culture (techniques, materials, patterns and decorative elements), as well as the intangible culture (music, oral knowledge and culinary traditions) as a resource.
To promote non-seasonal tourism as a form of sustainable development with a stable population settlement we are going to research the crafts linked to the territory and their implications, but we will also carry out a documentation of the productive processes. First and foremost, we are going to cater to the necessities of the local communities and pay attention to aspects related to societal groups at risk of exclusion, such as women, the elderly and the youth.
All this will be developed from a multidisciplinary perspective, for which we will count on the various teams —most of them linked to different countries— that will be part of the consortium. Each of these partners will contribute to the development, as well as to the final result of the project through input directly related to their area of ​​expertise: for example, among the collaborators we have intellectual teams specialized in the digitalization of heritage, research, or communication and dissemination, as well as as various institutions that will act as a testing ground for the more practical parts of the proposal. However, if something will characterize our work, it will be the constant collaboration between all parties, as well as the exchange of advice and experiences that will help to enrich collective knowledge and guarantee optimal results.
project.title: CULTUral heritage in RurAL remote areas for creative tourism and sustainabilITY
project.keywords: CRAFTMANSHIP, IMMATERIAL CULTURE, CULTURAL TOURISM, CREATIVE TOURISM, RURAL AREAS, DIGITALIZATION OF RURAL CULTURAL HERITAGE, LOCAL COMMUNITIES, SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT

article.title: Rural Europe’s economic woes spark innovative tourism solution

result.title: SWOT Reports
result.description: This report will include the SWOT analysis from T4.1-4.2. The characteristics of the regions participating in the project will be analysed, along with strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats, to understand local development strategies and foresight scenarios. It will consider the sites' current and future capacity, so visitors can enjoy the tangible and intangible cultural assets while maintaining the experience due to over-tourism. It will underline links between specific examples.

result.title: Inventory of Good Practices
result.description: It will be a collection of good practices on initiatives of the rural environment. Culturality will include Cases of good practices in using handicrafts, intangible heritage and contemporary art as a driver of sustainable development for remote rural areas. Otherwise, it will incorporate a schematic analysis of characteristics, the keys to success and problems found.

result.title: Vernacular architecture in the Navia river basin (Asturias, Spain)
Glossary of Key Terms in Cultural Heritage Training and Education
Detailed Project Management Handbook
result.description: At the beginning of the project, the coordinator will deliver a Project Management Handbook that includes the following sections: Project Basis (participants, duration, budget, contractual documents, etc; Project Structure, Management Structure with decision-making tools (Executive Board, leaders, etc.), and also procedures for practical cooperation, the list of meetings, general schedule, control measures, and conflict resolution, and the project follow-up procedure for the achievement of the same, with a follow-up of tasks and activities.

result.title: Assessing the impact of the new Mexico cable car on air pollution

result.title: Training Materials of Pilot Workshop
result.description: Based on the Literature background, and including the experiences of the project, the Training Materials will include teaching materials for local communities involved or to be involved in the programme, with differentiated target groups: such as women or the silver age. It will incorporate a syllabus and a prospectus planned educational activities.

result.title: First Dissemination, Communication and Exploitation (DCE) Plan
result.description: This first Communication and dissemination Plan will include the Culturality approach to disseminating and exploiting the project's results and communicating about the research with various audiences. It will contain an Impact section with three categories: exploitation of the results, market penetration strategy and intellectual property. It will explain the dissemination objectives and partners’ responsibility for dissemination.Plan that includes the project's approach to disseminating and exploiting the project's results as well as communicating about the research with various audiences.

result.title: First Policy Brief DG RTD
result.description: This report of Policy Brief to de DG RTD, the Commission department responsible for EU policy on research, science and innovation, will provide policy recommendations for the research and innovation on this field.

result.title: CULTURALITY Visual Identity and Branding Kit
result.description: This report will set the tone of the dissemination & communication Culturality' strategy. It will include templates, printed and online materials, as well as the unique project visual identity (logo, poster, leaflet, typography, roll-up, etc.). It will be the visual identity of the web, networks and dissemination actions.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
